section.name: Presentations
section.p:
From the Apache Harmony presentations listed below, you will get information about background,
motivation, history, status and future of the Apache Harmony project, learn how
Apache is building a compliant independent implementation of Java SE, and find out interesting facts about
developing the Java Platform with Eclipse.
These presentations might inspire you to participate in Harmony community activities.

ul.li: Apache Harmony: Implementing Java SE in Open Source, by Geir Magnusson Jr., presented at Emerging Technologies for the Enterprise Conference 2007.
EclipseCon 2007 Short Talk, by Tim Ellison, March 2007.
EclipseCon 2007 Poster, by Tim Ellison, March 2007.
Apache Harmony Approach to Implementing Java SE Platform, by Tim Ellison, Geir Magnusson Jr., 2006 JavaOne.
Apache Harmony, by Geir Magnusson Jr., 2005 JavaOne.

section.name: Research Papers
section.p: The papers listed below, provide a deep insight into the Apache Harmony research work.

ul.li: Hardware Atomicity for Reliable Software Speculation*, by Naveen Neelakantam, Ravi Rajwar, Suresh Srinivas, Uma Srinivasan and Craig Zilles, presented at 34-th International Symposium on Computer Architecture, San Diego, CA, June 2007.

Task-pushing: a Scalable Parallel GC Marking Algorithm without Synchronization Operations*, by Ming Wu, Xiao-Feng Li, presented at
21-st IEEE International Parallel and Distributed Processing Symposium, Long Beach, CA, March 26, 2007.

Behavior Characterization and Performance Study on Compacting Garbage Collectors with Apache Harmony *, by Chunrong Lai, Ivan T Volosyuk, and Xiao-Feng Li, presented at
Tenth Workshop on Computer Architecture Evaluation using Commercial Workloads held with HPCA-13, Phoenix, AZ, Feburary 2007.
